channel.title: Property and Interiors | Mail Online
channel.description: Check out the latest property news, stories and advice from around the world from the Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday

item.title: Calls for more help for cladding-hit flat owners after Commons vote
item.description: Protestors gathered outside Parliament to call for changes to the Building Safety Bill, as many leaseholders fear they could still have to pay life-changing sums.

item.title: Madonna lists her Hidden Hills estate for a whopping $25.9 million
item.description: The Like A Prayer hitmaker 63, originally purchased the Los Angeles-area property from fellow musician The Weeknd for $19.3 million in April 2021.

item.title: Doctor wins battle to lop his neighbour's 28ft Leylandii trees that he said blocked sunshine to home
item.description: Dr David Watts said his family's lives were being made a misery by the 15 cypress leylandii owned by James Henderson, 68, in the upmarket town of Bridge of Allan in Stirlingshire, Scotland.

item.title: Underground car park space listed for £350k in Knightsbridge
item.description: A parking spot in one of the most expensive parts of the country is for sale with a hefty price tag. The area measures just 3.18 by 6.30 metres, or 10 ft 4 inches by 20 ft by 6 inches.

item.title: Logan Paul sells his Encino estate for $7.405 million... earning a cool $800K profit
item.description: While the profit isn't quite as much as he had hoped for, Logan Paul is still in the black, after selling his Encino estate.

item.title: Distance from London is most influential factor for house prices in towns
item.description: The ONS explained that being closer to London was the most important factor associated with higher property prices.

item.title: Weligama Sri Lanka: New flats start from £114k
item.description: Southbeach Weligama is a new development of 106 flats in Sri Lanka, with prices ranging from £114k for a one-bed flat, to £832,978 for a four-bedroom flat.

item.title: Crackdown on borrowers taking big mortgages and failing to clear debts
item.description: Brokers warned that mortgage lending criteria will continue to be under the spotlight in the coming months as the cost of living crisis intensifies.

item.title: Phil Spencer on property prices and top tips for home movers
item.description: He says that moving home should be 'exciting' but problems typically crop up because it is a 'complex process with many moving parts.'

item.title: Rental property battle: A Notting Hill studio vs a country cottage
item.description: We take a look at two rental properties and ask which one would you pick? Both rent for around £2,200 a month, the average for London.

item.title: Cladding-hit flat owners say developers will delay repair works to avoid paying out
item.description: The Government has announced that it has reached an agreement with the industry that will see it contribute £5billion to address the building safety scandal.

item.title: Los Angeles mansion with 12-CAR garage, at-home movie theater, and bar on sale for $21.9 MILLION
item.description: Located on one of the most prestigious streets in Beverly Hills - Angelo Drive - the three-story modern home contains five bedrooms and seven bathrooms in total.

item.title: Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck look at $165MILLION mansion after deal for Bel-Air home falls through
item.description: Newly-engaged Jennifer, 52, and Ben, 49, were spotted together at the massive property on the market for a whopping $165million once called 'Spelling Manor' in LA suburb of Holmby Hills.

item.title: How expanding towns are 'swallowing up' rural communities
item.description: Planning reforms designed to help the government hit its target of 340,000 new homes a year are still expected to be a significant factor at local elections next month.

item.title: Which one of these cob houses for sale on Zoopla would you buy?
item.description: Which of these eco-friendly cob houses for sale on property website Zoopla would you choose to buy?

item.title: Can I object to a daytime dog kennel being installed underneath my leasehold flat?
item.description: Being a leasehold can be fraught with difficulties, but a good starting point is to read through your lease and look for anything related to this situation.

item.title: New York's Steinway Tower is the newest and skinniest skyscraper, writes TOM LEONARD
item.description: More than a quarter of a mile high but no more than 60 ft wide, the Steinway Tower, which has opened for residents, isn't just exceptionally tall, it is almost painfully thin.

item.title: Biggest home loans squeeze for a decade
item.description: Brokers have warned that soaring energy bills, tax rises, and the surging cost of goods have prompted banks to tighten their mortgage affordability tests.

item.title: Counties with the highest - and lowest - number of homes for sale are revealed on Rightmove
item.description: The counties with the highest number of homes per person locally are Dorset, East Sussex, Kent, Essex and Buckinghamshire, according to new data.

item.title: HS2 means house prices in the North are booming
item.description: In what's being touted as the 'HS2 effect', those located close to an HS2 station could see a spike in values of up to 60 per cent.

item.title: Retirement village residents gearing up for bumper Easter celebrations
item.description: There have been no Easter treats for the past 24 months - and they've been­ greatly missed. But this year they are back with gusto.

item.title: Flat in converted period property where founder of the Salvation Army lived is for sale for £700k
item.description: A blue plaque on the outside of the building by the front door reveals how Salvation Army founder William Booth lived in the London house from 1903 to 1912.

item.title: House prices: Halifax says they've grown £28k in a year
item.description: The national average house price has risen from £239,176 in March 2020 to £282,753 in March 2022, according to the latest Halifax index.

item.title: First ever net zero home designed by Max Fordham available for rent in Camden
item.description: The four-bedroom property in London's trendy Camden was designed for the late engineer and sustainable designer Max Fordham, who also lived in it.

item.title: Over-stretched luxury homeowners face become mortgage prisoners
item.description: Lenders are looking at business owners - who may typically pay themselves in dividends - and how recent dividend tax hikes will affect their ability to pay their mortgage.

item.title: MP David Warburton 'launched a luxury Airbnb using a loan from a controversial Russian tycoon'
item.description: Tory MP David Warburton - who is embroiled in a sex assault and drug scandal - launched a luxury Airbnb after taking a loan from a controversial Russian businessman, it is claimed.

item.title: Fort Belvedere where Edward VIII signed abdication was considered as home for William and Kate
item.description: Fort Belvedere, which is situated in Windsor Great Park, became the main residence of the future King Edward VIII in 1929, when he was the Prince of Wales

item.title: Rightmove: Five most viewed UK homes revealed
item.description: Britons browsing the property portal site are clearly still dreaming about living in a spacious home by the coast or in the countryside brimming with character and history.

item.title: Home hunters warned about buying off-plan as sales rise
item.description: Sales of properties that have not yet been built have risen for the first time since 2016, according to Hamptons estate agents.

item.title: How to prepare your garden when selling your home
item.description: Spring is in the air - and taking the time to spruce up the garden could add 5 per cent to the value of your home, according to experts.

item.title: Beach huts for sale: Would you pick the Dorset or Essex one?
item.description: Beach huts can range in price significantly, from a few thousands pounds to a few hundred thousand - we take a look at two at around £60k and ask which one would you pick?

item.title: Cladding-hit flat owners welcome scrapping of building safety manager
item.description: The amendments to the Fire Satefy Bill include the scrapping of the legal requirement for building owners to appoint a building safety manager.

item.title: Rishi Sunak hints households may get more help with bills in the autumn if energy price cap rises
item.description: The Chancellor hinted yesterday that he could provide further help with energy bills this autumn if gas and electricity costs continue to soar, raising hopes of government help in the autumn.

item.title: Five of the most expensive UK coastal homes for sale revealed
item.description: We revealed some of the most expensive homes for sale around Britain's shoreline, with price tags ranging from £2.25million to £12.5million.

item.title: Sunak's VAT cut on solar panels won't help cost of living crisis
item.description: Rishi Sunak said in the Spring Statement that he would remove VAT on energy efficient measures such as solar panels, heat pumps and insulation installed for five years.

item.title: Inside Molly-Mae Hague's new £4million six-bedroom home in affluent Cheshire
item.description: Molly-Mae Hague's new £4million six-bedroom home in affluent Cheshire boasts a luxurious contemporary design, 5,000 sq ft of land, and a tranquil garden, MailOnline can reveal.

item.title: Ministers' plush country homes like Chequers could be used to house Ukrainian refugees
item.description: The Prime Minister wants to see if Chequers, his own country retreat in Buckinghamshire, could be used to shelter those displaced by the Russian invasion.

item.title: We take a look at what homes you can buy around the country with a budget of £355,000
item.description: Values have increased a significant 10.4% during the past year to reach an average of £354,564, according to Rightmove.

item.title: A fifth of homes sold in a week, says Rightmove, as asking prices climb again
item.description: The average asking price of homes newly-listed climbed a further £5,760 to £354,564 in the month to mid-March, said the property listing website.

item.title: Would you pick a £3.7m bungalow in London or a £1.2m one in Lancashire?
item.description: Which one of these £1m-plus bungalows for sale would you choose to buy - one in South West London for £3.7m or one in Lancashire for £1.2m?

item.title: Resurgence of hobbies sparks huge demand for homes with extra rooms
item.description: Pastimes such as woodwork, knitting and painting are making a comeback - meaning homes with outbuildings or studio space are highly sought after.

item.title: More UK leaseholders freed from toxic ground rent clauses
item.description: Fifteen companies have agreed to remove toxic ground rent clauses that prevent homeowners from selling.

item.title: New £11M London pied-a-terre overlooks Hyde Park
item.description: The new development of just 15 luxury flats overlooks London's Hyde Park and includes flats ranging in price from £3million to around £11million.

item.title: Adele 'abandons plans to knock through two £11m London homes into one mega-mansion'
item.description: The singer, 33, is allegedly running out of time to start the project, with the ­planning application for the building ­running out in just seven weeks according to The Sun.

item.title: Former Surbiton home of David Essex for sale for £3m
item.description: The former home of 1970s singer and actor David Essex is for sale for £2,999,950 - and it boasts six bedrooms and a Surbiton postcode

item.title: Chelsea home of decorated nurse from World War 1 for sale at £7m
item.description: Dame Maud McCarthy was a British Army matron-in-chief who lived at the London property between 1919 and 1945, as highlighted by a blue plaque on its exterior wall.

item.title: Where have house asking prices grown the most in the last year?
item.description: The Devon hotspot of Brixham saw asking values jump 25% last month compared to a year earlier, reaching £329,699 on average, according to Rightmove.

item.title: Is Britain's self-build boom over as costs go through the roof?
item.description: They're the ultimate symbol of individuality - homes designed and built to your specifications, perhaps with you doing some of the heavy lifting.

item.title: Can I cut a property inheritance tax bill once probate has begun?
item.description: We are now faced with the confusing probate process and want to know if there is anything else we can do to limit our tax burden?

item.title: Britain's most affordable places to buy a home revealed
item.description: The list, revealed by Zoopla, looks at average local house prices compared to the combined income of an average two-earner household in the same location.

item.title: Neighbours was right: Cul-de-sacs are great places to live
item.description: Thanks to one sun-blushed, dead-end street down under, the much-ridiculed cul-de-sac burrowed its way into the nation's hearts.

item.title: How to add a pop of on-trend yellow to your home's interior
item.description: Having been out of fashion since the 1980s, yellow is back - interiors experts explain how to get this tricky shade right in your home.

item.title: How to bring Bridgerton style into your home
item.description: Fans of the popular series' interiors can use chandeliers, four-poster beds and gilt mirrors to add early 19th century touches to more contemporary homes.

item.title: What is 'house hijacking' and could it mean I lose my house?
item.description: I've heard about something called 'house hijacking'. What is it and could it mean that I lose my house? Are there any measures that I can take to prevent it?

item.title: Call for buy-to-let stamp duty tax to be abolished
item.description: Experts are calling for the 3% stamp duty surcharge paid by landlords to be abolished as it is taxing landlords out of the market, cutting the supply of rental homes, and leading to higher rents.

item.title: Will global headwinds, inflation and the cost of living crisis cool the property market?
item.description: Halifax reported that house prices rose 11% in February - but some predict that soaring household expenses could bring them down.

item.title: Which of these two homes with solar panels would you choose?
item.description: We take a look at two homes for sale with solar panels as part of our Property Battle series and ask which one would you choose?

item.title: How concrete is cementing a trendy new reputation in our homes
item.description: A handful of pioneering British companies are intent on tearing up the concrete rule book, and it's set to become the material of the year.

item.title: Cladding-hit flat owner says it will be six years before she can sell
item.description: We speak to Natalie Carter, a cladding-hit flat owner who has put her life on hold while she waits for her fire-trap home to be made safe, so she can then sell it.

item.title: Do I still have to pay my estate agent if I sell my home to a friend?
item.description: A buyer who tells a seller that 'I will save you commission' can be a blessing or a curse - our expert reveals what you can do protect yourself from

item.title: Wales announces a council tax clampdown on second homeowners
item.description: The Welsh Government has announced a clampdown on second homeowners, increasing the amount of council tax these owners pay by up to 300 per cent.

item.title: Residential parks offer a cheaper way to move to the country
item.description: A lodge on a residential park offers a cheaper way to buy in a beauty spot - but customers are urged to check that the operator is reputable.

item.title: The buy-to-let landlords hit hardest by tax changes
item.description: Higher rate taxpayers who invest in property using a smaller deposit have seen their returns slashed by as much as a third as a result of the stamp duty and tax relief tax changes.

item.title: For £1k a month, which of these homes on Zoopla would you choose to rent?
item.description: Which one of these two properties that are available to rent for £1,000 a month would you choose to live in?

item.title: Clever ways to remove pollutants from your home
item.description: Toxic fumes have caused four million premature deaths, according to Yale scientists - but there is an array of new 'clean air' technology that can help remove them.

item.title: Rampaging UK property prices will slow, Zoopla says
item.description: 'The global uncertainty and volatility resulting from the invasion of Ukraine will have economic impacts around the world, including the UK', Zoopla said in its latest House Price Index today.

item.title: Learn your lines: Stripes of all types are back in fashion
item.description: From wide, pastel-hued bands, to subtle, neutral ticking, stripes have featured in our homes for years. And now they're in the spotlight once again.

item.title: Move over, conservatories: Why a modern glass extension is the new must-have for your home
item.description: Conservatories have become dated - but 'glass box' extensions are a brighter alternative that offers true 'inside-outside' living.

item.title: Would you choose a lochside property in Scotland or one by the sea in Sandbanks?
item.description: We take a look at two properties at either end of mainland Britain, which both boast a stunning view from the house and ask which one would you choose?

item.title: Buy-to-let landlords struggle to keep up with new regulations
item.description: A study found that 27 per cent of landlords not up to speed wouldn't know where to start when it comes to understanding regulations.

item.title: Want to live the off-grid dream in one of the best places to live?
item.description: The architecturally designed eco-property off the south east coast of Scotland has solar panels, a wind turbine and a borehole water system.

item.title: Wealthy homeowners struggle to move due to a lack of properties for sale says Savills
item.description: A lack of properties for sale is being felt most is at the expensive end of the property market, according to estate agents Savills.

item.title: Living in Bristol: How its population has grown 10% in a decade
item.description: Many have discovered the city's advantages recently: last year its population hit 465,900, which is 10 per cent up on a decade earlier and well ahead of the national average.

item.title: Second cladding nightmare: Building works leave cladding-hit flat owners in cold flats
item.description: Remediation works at a cladding-hit tower block in Canary Wharf have begun, leaving residents in cold conditions and with restricted access to daylight.

item.title: Cladding-hit flat owners welcome cap on repair costs
item.description: Cladding-hit flat owners have been told they will have cap on the amount they pay of £15,000 for those living in London and £10,000 for those living outside of the capital.

item.title: There's incomplete bullding work at our leasehold flats, what can we do?
item.description: Former judge Stephen Gold explains the options in this case, including making a claim under a warranty to get the incomplete construction work repaired.

item.title: How to turn a bedroom into a home office as data shows millions have done it
item.description: The extra time spent at home during several lockdowns led to 41% of homeowners changing their indoor space.

item.title: Tenants face supply crisis amid calls for an extra 230,000 rental homes a year
item.description: A new study found that substantial investment is needed in the rental market to ensure that a sufficient supply of rental properties is available in the years ahead.

item.title: New leasehold homes protected on ground rent but existing ones aren't
item.description: A divide in the property market has been created as a result of legislation that restricts ground rents to effectively zero on new leasehold properties only, leaving existing leaseholders unprotected.

item.title: Would you want a £45k luxury outdoor kitchen to enjoy all year round?
item.description: Lorraine and James Stait installed a spectacular outdoor kitchen, used all year round for everything from pizza parties to cooking a roast.

item.title: Hotspot vs not-hot spot property battle: Margate flat vs Middlesbrough house
item.description: Margate and Middlesbrough have been identified as having the biggest and smallest increases in property asking prices during the past decade.

item.title: Wacky wax works: Classy candles are now becoming trendy pieces of art
item.description: Once, we might have used tealights, but now the trend is for quirky candles in the shape of classical busts, modernist forms or humorous trompe l'oeil.

item.title: Bungalows are back: Single-storey homes in demand and rising in price
item.description: There is a 'B' word so offensive to some estate agents that they dare not speak its name - bungalow. Heaven knows why!

item.title: How to choose a bath towel and which colours are the most popular
item.description: We speak to some experts about how to choose a towel, how to keep it in tip top condition and why you should only dry towels in the shade.

item.title: Margate tops the list of hotspots where property values have doubled in a decade
item.description: Rightmove identified the top ten locations that have seen these figures rise the most - and least - during the past decade.

item.title: Oxfordshire home of playboy and jockey Sir William Pigott-Brown for sale
item.description: The Oxfordshire mansion was once home to playboy aristocrat Sir William Pigott-Brown, known as the 'sporting baronet'.

item.title: Average rents edge towards £1k a month says Zoopla
item.description: The typical rent is £969 a month, according to Zoopla, which said a single earner can expect to spend 37% of their gross income on rent.

item.title: Blinds and the rooms they are best for: From Roman to Day & Night
item.description: The wide range of blinds that are available means choosing one can be more complicated than perhaps initially expected, we get some expert help.

item.title: The flat owners facing huge bills without energy price cap protection
item.description: Some blocks of flats are supplied by a single energy supplier, which leaves residents unprotected by Ofgem's price cap.
item.media:credit: Shutterstock / Gary L Hider / Shutterstock / cktravels.com / Shutterstock / Marian Weyo / Shutterstock / Tom Plesnik

item.title: Dare to bare: Get the industrial chic look with a raw plaster finish
item.description: Bare, plastered walls - popular since the time of the ancient Egyptians and long-prized for their hard-wearing properties and sense of depth - are back.

item.title: Heavenly conversions: Take a leap of faith and make a church your home
item.description: A report by the National Churches Trust suggests that as many as 368 ecclesiastical buildings have been earmarked for closure within five years.

item.title: Most viewed overseas homes in January 2022 revealed
item.description: We take a look inside the most viewed homes for sale overseas on property website Rightmove, including three French manor houses.

item.title: It takes just 15 seconds for those walking through a front door to decide if a house is clean
item.description: Spurred on by online cleaning icon Mrs Hinch (pictured), people are quick to judge about the cleanliness of other people's homes.

item.title: Soaring insurance sends cladding victim's service charge rocketing
item.description: Grandmother Julie Fraser, 59, bought the two-bedroom flat in Cheshire - in 2016 and has since seen the block's buildings insurance rise to more than £500,000 a year.

item.title: Zoopla's most viewed homes for sale: From a clifftop home to a gatehouse
item.description: The most popular properties for sale online at the beginning of 2022 have been revealed, and they include some unique homes.

item.title: Converted watermills and windmills make wonderfully unusual homes
item.description: Despite having oddly shaped rooms and a need for constant maintenance, watermills and windmills are some of the most sought-after properties.

item.title: Warm and calming pastels are back in our homes this winter
item.description: They were once associated with nurseries and a vintage 1950s look - but used in a contemporary way, sugary pinks, blues, yellows and greens can be incredibly fashionable.

item.title: Detached homes see average values up £60k during the pandemic says Halifax
item.description: Buyers can expect to pay on average £425,177 for a detached property, which is an increase of £60,556 or 17% since the March 2020.

item.title: What's the best way of getting rid of black mould in my home?
item.description: Left untreated, black mould can be dangerous - particularly to young children and those with underlying respiratory issues - as the spores released from mould can get into their lungs.

item.title: Rents rise at fastest rate on record, says Rightmove
item.description: High demand among tenants and a low supply of good rental homes means there is fierce competition in the rental market.

item.title: Swedish DJ Eric Prydz is selling £1.55m party pad in London via Fletchers estate agents
item.description: DJ Eric Prydz's former home is for sale and has a 30ft open plan living area with a dark kitchen partially tucked under a floating staircase and a hot tub that can be viewed from the sofa.

item.title: Inside three new chalets for sale in Les Gets ski resort
item.description: Les Gets is is only an hour's drive from Geneva Airport - making it the perfect destination for British skiers and snowboarders looking for easy access to the Alps.

item.title: Paint colour of 2022 is a deep purple called Very Peri
item.description: Pantone has controversially selected Very Peri, a shade inspired by the deep violet blue of the periwinkle flower, as the colour of 2022.

item.title: Former London home of Joseph Conrad for sale for £1,625,000
item.description: The pretty property in Pimlico has a blue plaque on the front confirming the writer's provenance, and is on the market for £1,625,000.

item.title: How to pick the right estate agent to sell your home
item.description: We may still be in January but the race is already under way in the 2022 housing market - and for canny sellers, there's no time to lose.

item.title: Number of first-time buyers rises 35% in a year, says Halifax
item.description: The number of first-time buyers has increased 35% in a year to a record level of 409,370, according to Halifax.

item.title: I'm can't sell my flat due to cladding issues, will Gove's proposals help me?
item.description: I can't sell due to the prospect of a bill for remediation works, which include 'unsafe cladding, flammable balconies and missing cavity barriers'.

item.title: Have you overlooked these rental checks or has your landlord?
item.description: Happy tenants often make for a happy landlord and this checklist of legal obligations and best practice can help rentals be a success.

item.title: Designer Sophie Robinson paints a room black on Dream Home Makeovers
item.description: We spoke to Sophie about the first episode of her new show, including painting the walls and ceilings a room black to make it more homely.

item.title: What could a family buy in London on the average salary?
item.description: To highlight how difficult it would be to buy a home, we looked at family properties in London for someone with a 10% deposit borrowing 4.5 times the median salary.

item.title: Record number of £5m-plus homes sold in London, says Savills
item.description: The number of £5million-plus homes sold in London in 2021 reached 522, with 163 sales of them in the last three months of that year alone.

item.title: Property battle: Would you choose £750k two-bed flat or £1.3m four-bed house in Sandbanks?
item.description: We take a look at two properties for sale in Sandbanks, Dorset, and ask - as part of our Property Battle series - which one would you prefer to buy?

item.title: Interiors trends for 2022: It's all about vibrant designs and natural textures
item.description: Sustainable design and open-plan living are here to stay, according to designers, but matching furniture and round beds may be due for a refresh.

item.title: 'We bought a garden sauna': How to get the best and what they cost
item.description: Saunas have exploded in popularity since the start of the pandemic, as stressed-out Britons installed then in their gardens to help them relax.

item.title: Cladding victim faces bankruptcy even if her repair bill is paid
item.description: Charlotte Meehan said owners of flats in her block in East London were being 'bled dry' by the soaring cost of interim fire safety measures that are in place while they wait for cladding repair works to begin.

item.title: London only just pips Cornwall as most searched area for homes
item.description: Despite London's population of 9 million dwarfing Cornwall's 600,000, the difference in searches over 2021 was just 3 per cent.

item.title: School catchments: Quarter of parents admit to bending the rules
item.description: A total of 24 per cent of parents admitted to flouting school admissions criteria to get their child into their preferred local school.

item.title: People who sold homes last year made an average £95k
item.description: The research by Hamptons revealed that a record 92 per cent of sellers sold their property last year for more than they bought it, having owned it for an average of 8.8 years.

item.title: Ground rents and why you may not be able to sell your leasehold flat
item.description: Have you checked to see if you have a toxic ground rent clause in the lease on your flat, which has left many other leaseholders unable to sell their flats?

item.title: Former Pie 'n' Mash shop in East London is transformed into a modern £1m home
item.description: The pie 'n' mash shop continues to look like a trading outlet from the outside as it retains its original signage, but has been transformed inside into a £1m home for sale.

item.title: What's on the cards for property prices in 2022?
item.description: Home working changed the way we live during the pandemic, as the price of a detached property surged 14%. But will the shift to spacious, rural locations become permanent?

item.title: Homeowners with period properties must spend on energy improvements
item.description: Some 79 per cent of homeowners surveyed with properties built before 1900 were aware they need to make changes to cut their home's carbon footprint.

item.title: Where can you buy a home in Britain for under £150,000?
item.description: The areas that are accessible to buyers with a £150,000 budget have dropped significantly during the pandemic, according to estate agents Savills.

item.title: Property battle: Two homes with state of the art gyms
item.description: As New Year fitness resolutions arrive, we take a look at two luxury properties that boast well-equipped state of the art gyms to help you get in shape.

item.title: London semi-detached house featured in Rachel Weisz film is for sale for £1.6m
item.description: The 2017 film Disobedience was filmed at the five-bedroom London house, which is for sale with an asking price of £1.6million.

item.title: Somerset's Taunton sees biggest house price rises, says Halifax
item.description: Halifax has revealed the areas with the biggest house price rises - and Somerset's Taunton tops the list.

item.title: Taylor Wimpey is latest developer to remove toxic ground rent clauses
item.description: Taylor Wimpey has removed the clauses in purchasers' leasehold contracts that saw their ground rents double every 10 years.

item.title: Where are the most expensive streets to live in Britain?
item.description: Top of the list of most expensive streets is Tite Street in Chelsea and Kensington, where the average value of a home is just under £30million.

item.title: PROPERTY CLINIC: Can we stop development by registering as a Village Green?
item.description: It has been used without hindrance by the public for recreational purposes for more than 20 years. Would this exclude it from the 'development site'?

item.title: Blown Away by glass: The best delicate baubles and ornaments in shops this Christmas
item.description: Delicate decorations are on-trend for this Christmas and beyond. We round up the best glass baubles, vases and tumblers in the shops right now.

item.title: Reinvent then rent! How to turn a former bank, church or pub into a popular holiday let
item.description: Where have all the old public buildings gone - the post offices, banks, churches and pubs - many have been converted into holiday lets.

item.title: How to deal with a dispute with your neighbour
item.description: New advice from the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors aims to help bring neighbours together and avoid a war of words this Christmas.

item.title: Axe plans to make landlords pay to boost energy efficiency, say campaigners
item.description: The Government has proposed that by 2025 all new rental properties should have an energy rating of C or better - and landlords should pick up the tab of the improvements.

item.title: Homeowner with £70k cladding bill says fight for justice is a second job
item.description: Steph Pike, 30, a solicitor (pictured) tells us about much time she spends fighting the £70,000 cladding repair bill she faces and helping others.

item.title: How to use a homeowner's 'right to light' to prevent a neighbour's extension
item.description: Right to Light can be a separate issue to planning and affect your extension or a neighbours's even if planning permission has been granted.

item.title: Grand Designs round house in Devon for sale for £1.45m
item.description: The four-bedroom house on the South coast of Devon was described by Grand Designs presenter Kevin McCloud as 'quirky'.

item.title: Rents rise 23% in ​the pandemic in the South West but drop in London
item.description: All regions across the country have seen a rise in rents, except from Inner London, where values are still below the start of the pandemic.

item.title: How to add space to your home without building a big extension
item.description: The 'race for space' has been the big property story over the past year - but there is no need to take on a major building project if you follow these clever tips.

item.title: Minute makeovers: There's still time to refresh your home decor before Christmas
item.description: December is no time to start big interiors projects. But if you are pining to give your home a facelift, here are some of the best quick-fix solutions.

item.title: Five properties for sale with the average Halifax Welsh house price of £205k
item.description: Average house prices in Wales have risen 14.8% during the past year, to reach £204k, one of Britain's biggest lenders says - the strongest growth of any region.

item.title: Most popular homes for sale on Rightmove in 2021 are revealed
item.description: The most viewed homes for sale have been revealed with a luxury £15million home in Essex with 52 acres at the top of the list.

item.title: Bank of Mum and Dad forking out £32k on average to help kids buy homes
item.description: A total of 64 per cent of parents said they had offered financial assistance with the deposit, with the average contribution amounting to £32,440.

item.title: House and 54 acres for sale near Amanda Owen's Our Yorkshire Farm
item.description: A property with 54.5 acres of land is available to buy near Ravenseat Farm, home to shepherdess Amanda Owen, her husband of 21 years Clive, and their nine children.

item.title: Top tips on how to avoid a large energy bill this winter
item.description: We take a look at 10 top tips for saving money on your heating, which include things to do and things to avoid doing.

item.title: Eco-friendly products for your home from bed throws to carpet runners
item.description: We take a look at some homeware products made from recycled goods such as plastic bottles and glass jars.

item.title: Would you pick a home on the Isle of Wight or one on the Isle of Skye?
item.description: We take a look at two different properties for sale on islands off the mainland of Britain, the Isle of Skye and the Isle of Wight

item.title: These little-known towns and villages have become pandemic property hotspots
item.description: The relatively anonymous town of Daventry in Northamptonshire has been named the number one property hotspot by estate agent Hamptons.

item.title: 'Colour drenching' interiors trend sees walls, ceiling and woodwork painted the SAME colour
item.description: 'Softly, softly' has largely been the approach to painted walls in recent years, but that's about to change. We explain how 'colour drenching' could transform your home.

item.title: Bournemouth is the most popular coastal town for buyers, says Rightmove
item.description: Rightmove identified the top ten most in-demand coastal areas in Britain, led by Bournemouth, and followed by Southampton and Brighton.

item.title: Ski home values rise by up to 17% despite travel restrictions says Savills
item.description: Estate agents Savills tracked 44 resorts globally, and found that the average price of a ski property has risen 5.1% in the past year.
